snippet: Two-thirds of the nearly two million people deported since President Obama took office had committed only minor infractions or had no criminal record, a New York Times analysis has found.
abstract: New York Times analysis shows that two-thirds of the nearly two million deportation cases since Pres Obama took office have involved people who committed only minor infractions or had no criminal record at all; data belies claims by administration that it has narrowed its deportation efforts to focus on dangerous criminals, and illuminates one of the most contentious issues of Obama's presidency.

byline.original: By GINGER THOMPSON and SARAH COHEN

lead_paragraph: Two-thirds of the nearly two million people deported since President Obama took office had committed only minor infractions or had no criminal record, a New York Times analysis has found.

headline.main: More Deportations Follow Minor Crimes, Records Show
headline.print_headline: More Deportations Follow Minor Crimes, Data Shows
